chapter.title: Language reference

blockquote.para: This chapter provides a reference of Tarantool data operations and administrative commands.

chapter.para:
Unlike many other key/value servers, Tarantool uses different TCP ports and client/server protocols for data manipulation and administrative statements. On start up, the server connects to three TCP ports:
Read/write data port, to handle INSERTs, UPDATEs, DELETEs and SELECTs.
The default value of the port is 33013, as defined in primary_port configuration option.
Read only port, which only accepts SELECTs, port number 33014, as defined in secondary_port configuration option.
Administrative port, which defaults to 33015, and is defined in admin_port configuration option.
The data protocol is binary; a complete description is provided in doc/box-protocol.txt.

separation of ports is done in part to allow system administrators to secure the read/write port or the administrative port. The values of read-only, read-write and administrative ports can be specified in the configuration file.
How command line client understands what port to use.
